text: Krastavac Bacan is from Plastenik, instead of the market. Bacan is made for our buyers. There are other vegetables on the unseen hills. Since I mainly produce paprika, I mostly sell paprika. Manufacturers from the surrounding area asked if the vegetables were thrown away because of the low retail prices.
The first class costed 80 cents, the second costed 40 cents, which would give us a quarter of the price. At that price, it is literally impossible to produce paprika, let alone harvest it.

We, with 20 or 25 cents, can't bargain with anyone. Pick up a ton of cucumbers for 200 euros. So, where's the water? Where's the food? Where are the workers? Where are we? The income and expenses explain it all. The harvest is almost equal to that of an engineer. The total price does not cover it.

So far, I have thrown 8 to 10 tons. I felt like I was crying. The total prices have now grown, so the throwing has stopped. But the question is until when, because the market is not stable. We are in front of the area where in the spring the cabbage grew, which we unfortunately had to plow. The offered price was 17 cents, on which we could not do our consumption production. Desperate farmers are asking for the protection of the state.

I, as a producer, can't lose half of it, and someone else has to get rich with my labor and take a euro more. We don't blame the buyers, who offer us very low prices, because it is clear to us that everyone will buy where it is cheaper. But in order to protect domestic production, it is necessary to introduce, as far as I know, from May 1st to October 1st, that is, to prohibit importation, except for the culture, which is insufficient for us.

The import of food jumped by 11%. We pay only 270 million euros for vegetables. Similarly, domestic food is thrown away. To get to the point where that tourist eats our domestic food, and not imported from Ukraine, Albania, Macedonia and so on. Third countries are more competitive because they pay cheaper labor and do not use expensive protective equipment that are due to be used by the member countries. And all this food, the vegetables could not even donate. They asked, they say, to pay the tax first.
